intro: Lasianthaea calva, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal dunes or open woodlands. Due to its ecological significance, it is considered a key species in stabilizing sandy habitats.
